oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup Aired Performance - 1946-09-30 - KOMA - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of an aired performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on September 30, 1946 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lem Hawkins; Dick Reinhart; Hiram Higsby; Oklahoma Songbirds; Mary Lou; Chuck Davis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Lem Hawkins and Hiram Higsby tell a joke [incomplete] / (1:22) Lem Hawkins performs "[Unidentified banjo tune]" / (3:06) Allan Page and Hiram Higsby tell a joke / (3:30) Dick Reinhart performs "Tumbling Tumbleweed" / (6:06) Lem Hawkins and Hiram Higsby tell a joke / (6:43) Lem Hawkins and Hiram Higsby perform a medley of "Ain’t You Coming Back To Old New Hampshire Molly", "When You Wore A Tulip", and "Down In Jungle Town" / (8:40) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (9:32) The Oklahoma Songbirds perform "Time Changes Everything" / (11:20) Hiram Higsby introduces the next song / (11:32) Dick Reinhart and Mary Lou perform "Let The Lower Lights Be Burning" / (12:51) Chuck Davis performs the closing theme / (14:21) Closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Reinhart, Dick; Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975; Davis, Chuck;
